title.rendered: I have to go where to make a territory?!

content.rendered:
Perhaps you too have been suffering from the frustration of The Enterprise Territory Management design for Model to Territory creation.

The Territory Model before…  You needed to click view hierarchy after navigating to your territory model, which wouldn’t be that bad except….

Your usability problem is solved!

Du-Du-Du-DUUUU Introducing the “new territory” button!!

It only took me 2 implementations and 5 territory models, but I finally added a ‘New Territory’ button easy peasy.  You can copy my gist on GitHub (FYI the image below will take you directly to my gist since I can’t embed the gist)

excerpt.rendered: Don’t be frustrated about the steps to create your territories from your territory model, use a button!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Ideas:  New Territory Button
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I know I made my own territory button, but it would be nice if I wouldn't have had to.... That's why there is the amazing IdeaExchange for us to vote for features and functionality we want, like a new territory button. Vote to have a "New Territory" button added to…

img.alt_text: Oh if only the territory model had better usability

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Idea:  Enterprise Territory Mangement Rule Opportunity Filter
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Just posted a new Idea, thanks to the Territory Management Group, to have the Run Opportunity Filter class button visible all the time on the territory hierarchy with help text to explain the button is only available to push when the model is active. Care to vote? https://success.salesforce.com/ideaView?id=08730000000oMVqAAM

jetpack-related-posts.title: Save Yourself Some Time & Increase Report Type Usability
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Custom report types can be your BFF, helping you report on things you never thought you could in Salesforce, but you need to take the time to increase their usability. It only takes one, then you can clone... :-)

jetpack-related-posts.title: Named Account Model Implementation: Part 1 – Before We Begin
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Implementation of a Named Account Model is a large undertaking. It can be stressful for even the most experienced admin, but it doesn't have to be. This post reviews the concept of what a named account model is and high level requirements before planning your project.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Documentation and User Help
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Greetings Post Readers, I told you I would be back to let you know about Org Documentation and Help Sites so here I am. When it comes to org documentation I have to tell you, mine is either SO BEYOND THROUGH that it would kill many trees to print, OR…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Community Sharing Part 1: Sharing Sets – Your First Step in Sharing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Sharing Sets are an amazing superpower that comes with your Communities. They are a way to share with Community License types and Community users. Keep in mind, this type of security and sharing is only available for your community users, it is not available to share with internal users.
